intro: Lithospermum divaricatum, commonly known as the variable lithosperm, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Lithospermum divaricatum is known for its medicinal properties, with its roots containing compounds used in traditional herbal remedies.
